meanings.definition: Anointing with oil or ointment as a religious rite or as a symbol of investiture with a special function.
meanings.sent1: During the ceremony, the priest performed the unctions on the new king.
meanings.sent2: The unctions conducted by the bishop were a sacred tradition.
meanings.sent3: The unctions at the temple were so elaborate that they ran out of oil!
meanings.sent4: The unctions on the champion athlete symbolized his victory.
meanings.sent5: The sweet scent of the unctions lingered in the air long after the ceremony.

meanings.definition: The act of anointing as a medical treatment or religious rite.
meanings.sent1: The nurse applied the unctions to the patient's wounds to aid in healing.
meanings.sent2: In some cultures, unctions are believed to have healing properties.
meanings.sent3: The doctor's unctions were so gentle that they calmed the patient instantly.
meanings.sent4: The unctions given to the sick child brought comfort to the worried parents.
meanings.sent5: The herbal unctions used by the healer smelled of lavender and chamomile.

meanings.sent1: Her constant unctions towards her boss made her colleagues roll their eyes.
meanings.sent2: The politician's unctions towards the voters seemed insincere.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's unctions about his own jokes were quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: The teacher's unctions towards the student's mediocre work were unwarranted.
meanings.sent5: The singer's unctions towards her fans were met with adoration and skepticism.
